intro: Hymenolepis crithmifolia, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and feathery foliage, which are typical of the carrot family. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in coastal areas, often growing on rocky shores or sandy soils. Its small, delicate flowers are arranged in umbels, and the plant produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Hymenolepis crithmifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and hardy nature.
